title: Christopher Rea, “The Age of Irreverence: A New History of Laughter in China” (University of California Press, 2015)
description:
Christopher Rea‘s new book explores five kinds of laughter that emerged from the tumultuous first decades of China’s twentieth century: jokes, play, mockery, farce, and humor.
